info.title: Jump Host API
info.description: A simple API to manage tunnel entries and exits on a dedicated jump host.

inner_intf.description: The name of the network interface that faces towards the edge network

outer_intf.description: The name of the network interface that faces towards the first black network

inner_subnet.description: The subnet to route towards the inner interface (aka. the edge network/device)

outer_subnet.description: The subnet to route towards the tunnel (aka. the other edge network/device)

local_port.description: The local port to use to bind the tunnel

remote_end.description: The remote address to contact as the other side of the tunnel

private_key.description: The private key to use for authentication of the tunnel to the other side

public_key.description: The public key to use for authentication of the tunnel from the other side

put.description: Issues a new authentication token in exchange for credentials. Currently requires no credentials, this is up to future implementations.

/tunnel_entry.summary: Manages tunnel entries on the jump host

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The authentication token issued by prior login

requestBody.description: The tunnel entry to create. The id will be checked for conflicts and inherited from the request.

404.description: A specified interface could not be found

406.description: A value exceeds the allowed range

409.description: Tunnel entry id or specified ports already in use

507.description: Already too many tunnel entries in use
